title: Chamath Palihapitiya
deleted: Palihapitiya is a huge advocate of [[Tesla, Inc.|Tesla]] and green energy.

title: Chamath Palihapitiya
added: In 2021, Palihapitiya helped take Clover Health, a [[Medicare (United States)|Medicare]] insurance start-up backed by [[Alphabet Inc.]], public through a SPAC.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.cnbc.com/2020/10/06/chamath-palihapitiya-to-take-clover-health-public-in-another-spac-deal-worth-3point7-billion.html|title=Chamath Palihapitiya to take Clover Health public in another SPAC deal worth $3.7 billion|work=[[CNBC]]|first=Yun|last=Li|date=October 6, 2020|access-date=January 28, 2021}}</ref>

title: Chamath Palihapitiya
deleted: Some see{{By whom|date=January 2021}} Palihapitiya as a "stock promoter" due to his frequent appearances on TV and high volume of SPAC warrants and options.<ref>{{Cite web|last=Aliaj|first=Ortenca|date=November 13, 2020|title=The Spac sponsor bonanza|url=https://www.ft.com/content/9b481c63-f9b4-4226-a639-238f9fae4dfc|url-status=live|archive-url=|archive-date=|access-date=|website=Financial Times}}</ref>

title: Chamath Palihapitiya
deleted: | net worth          = US$15 billion (February 2021) <ref>{{Cite web|last=|first=|date=|title=Bloomberg interview february 2021 (33 min. 20 sec.).|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wqtd8CuqF7A&t=2072s|url-status=live|archive-url=|archive-date=|access-date=|website=}}</ref>

title: Chamath Palihapitiya
added: In 2019, an Ontario judge ordered Palihapitiya and two former partners to pay $15.69 million to plaintiffs in an Ontario Superior Court ruling that found the three had conspired to acquire mobile software development shop Xtreme Labs at a discounted price, in addition to breached contractual obligations with EVP.<ref>{{Cite web|date=2019-05-15|title=Ontario judge rules against Xtreme Labs co-founders, Chamath Palihapitiya in Tinder-focused lawsuit {{!}} BetaKit|url=https://betakit.com/ontario-judge-rules-against-xtreme-labs-co-founders-chamath-palihapitiya-in-tinder-focused-lawsuit/|access-date=2021-03-10|language=en-CA}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|last=MacMillan|first=Douglas|date=2015-03-11|title=Tinder Hook Up Leads to a Lawsuit|language=en-US|work=Wall Street Journal|url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/tinder-hook-up-leads-to-a-lawsuit-1426100168|access-date=2021-03-10|issn=0099-9660}}</ref>

title: Chamath Palihapitiya
added: On March 6, 2011, [[Yahoo Finance]] reported that Chamath reflected that "his relative performance vs the S&P500 [was] 3.6% compared to 2.3%, or 56% above the benchmark."<ref>{{cite news |last1=Katje |first1=Chris |title=Chamath Palihapitiya Shares Lessons Learned After Tough Week For SPACs |url=https://finance.yahoo.com/news/chamath-palihapitiya-shares-lessons-learned-201953184.html |access-date=27 March 2021 |agency=Yahoo Finance |publisher=Verizon Media}}</ref> It was later criticized by venture capitalists, investors, and financiers that his reporting of his statistics as 56% above the benchmark, rather than as 1.3% above the benchmark, could be seen as 'inflationary,' 'non-kosher,' or 'manipulative of Main Street's view of him as an investor.'<ref>{{cite web |last1=Palihapitiya |first1=Chamath |title=relative performance vs the S&P500... |url=https://twitter.com/chamath/status/1368247774966206464 |access-date=27 March 2021}}</ref>

title: Chamath Palihapitiya
added: On March 6,2021, [[Yahoo Finance]] reported that Chamath reflected that "his relative performance vs the S&P500 [was] 3.6% compared to 2.3%, or 56% above the benchmark."<ref>{{cite news |last1=Katje |first1=Chris |title=Chamath Palihapitiya Shares Lessons Learned After Tough Week For SPACs |url=https://finance.yahoo.com/news/chamath-palihapitiya-shares-lessons-learned-201953184.html |access-date=27 March 2021 |agency=Yahoo Finance |publisher=Verizon Media}}</ref> It was later criticized by venture capitalists, investors, and financiers that his reporting of his statistics as 56% above the benchmark, rather than as 1.3% above the benchmark, could be seen as 'inflationary,' 'non-kosher,' or 'manipulative of Main Street's view of him as an investor.'<ref>{{cite web |last1=Palihapitiya |first1=Chamath |title=relative performance vs the S&P500... |url=https://twitter.com/chamath/status/1368247774966206464 |access-date=27 March 2021}}</ref>
